citeinfo.title: Provisional Multi-GAS Volcanic Gas Monitoring Data, Obsidian Pool thermal area, Yellowstone National Park
citeinfo.geoform: ASCII text files in the *.dat and *.xlsx formats

descript.abstract:
This release presents provisional volcanic gas monitoring data from multi-GAS (multiple Gas Analyzer System) station "YELL_MUD", installed in July 2021 in the Obsidian Pool thermal area, Yellowstone National Park, USA. The multi-GAS station includes gas sensors to measure water vapor, carbon dioxide (CO2), sulfur dioxide (SO2), and hydrogen sulfide (H2S) in gas plumes, as well as meteorologic parameters (wind speed and direction, ambient temperature and relative humidity, ambient pressure), and the temperature of a nearby geothermal feature. The station is duty cycled to conserve power and collects data for 30 minutes every 6 hours beginning at 00:00, 06:00, 12:00, and 18:00 UTC. Before each measurement cycle the gas sensors' baseline responses are checked by recirculating trapped air through chemical scrubbers (soda lime and anhydrite) to remove acid gases and water vapor. On-site CO2, SO2, and H2S standard gases are sampled every 28.25 days to verify the sensor responses. High-rate data are logged onsite and half-hourly averaged values from each sample cycle, along with baseline ('zero') and verification ('span') results, are telemetered every 6 hours by a BGAN satellite system. The half-hourly averages and diagnostic data obtained via telemetry are presented herein. Real-time values from the station can be viewed on the USGS Yellowstone monitoring webpage by clicking on the small 'gas cloud' icon (https://www.usgs.gov/volcanoes/yellowstone). Please note that the data presented herein are provisional, as described below. For a more detailed technical description of the multi-GAS instrument please see Lewicki et al., 2017.
PROVISIONAL DATA DISCLAIMER: These data are preliminary or provisional and are subject to revision. They are being provided to meet the need for timely best science. The data have not received final approval by the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) and are provided on the condition that neither the USGS nor the U.S. Government shall be held liable for any damages resulting from the authorized or unauthorized use of the data. While every effort is made to obtain accurate measurements, volcanic environments can be extremely harsh and provisional data and results generated by automated processing routines have not been analyst-reviewed and may be inaccurate due to instrument malfunctions, sensor drift, or other problems. Any such problems may take some time to address due to the remote location of the site. Users are cautioned to carefully consider the provisional nature of the data before using it. Information concerning the accuracy and appropriate uses of these data may be obtained from the USGS.
Reference Lewicki, J.L., Kelly, P.J., Bergfeld, D., Vaughan, R.G., Lowenstern, J.B., 2017. Monitoring gas and heat emissions at Norris Geyser Basin, Yellowstone National Park, USA based on a combined eddy covariance and Multi-GAS approach. J. Volcanol. Geotherm. Res. 347, 312â€“326. https://doi.org/10.1016/J.JVOLGEORES.2017.10.001
descript.purpose: The composition of volcanic emissions are monitored for volcano monitoring and hazard mitigation.

idinfo.useconst: These data are preliminary or provisional and are subject to revision. They are being provided to meet the need for timely best science. The data have not received final approval by the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) and are provided on the condition that neither the USGS nor the U.S. Government shall be held liable for any damages resulting from the authorized or unauthorized use of the data.
idinfo.datacred: This work is permitted by the U.S. National Park Service

attracc.attraccr: No formal attribute accuracy tests were conducted

dataqual.logic: No formal logical accuracy tests were conducted
dataqual.complete: Data set is considered complete for the information presented, as described in the abstract. Users are advised to read the rest of the metadata record carefully for additional details.

horizpa.horizpar: No formal positional accuracy tests were conducted

vertacc.vertaccr: No formal positional accuracy tests were conducted

procstep.procdesc: These data are preliminary or provisional and are subject to revision. They are being provided to meet the need for timely best science. The data have not received final approval by the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) and are provided on the condition that neither the USGS nor the U.S. Government shall be held liable for any damages resulting from the authorized or unauthorized use of the data.

enttyp.enttypd: Summary of chemical and diagnostic values collected during 30-minute-long sampling cycles that are initiated every 6 hours.

attr.attrdef: Timestamp from datalogger's internal clock.

attrdomv.udom: Timestamp from datalogger's internal clock.

attr.attrdef: A unique number assigned to each row of observations in a data table.

attrdomv.udom: A unique number assigned to each row of observations in a data table.

attr.attrdef: Name of multi-GAS instrument and/or location.

attrdomv.udom: Name of multi-GAS instrument and/or location

attr.attrdef: Numeric indication of the number of hours between sample cycles.

edom.edomvd: Numeric indication of the number of hours between sample cycles.

attr.attrdef: Numerical indicator of the operational state of the Multi-GAS station.

edom.edomvd: Gas sensors off.
Gas sensors warming up.
Automated baseline check for gas sensors where gas is circulated through soda lime and anhydrite chemicals to remove water vapor, CO2, SO2, and H2S.
Sampling.
Sensors settling prior to sampling or after an automated baseline check or span check.
Automated H2S sensor verification where field-deployed H2S standard gas is sampled.
Automated CO2 and SO2 sensor verifications where a field-deployed CO2 + SO2 standard gas mixture is sampled.
Manual baseline check for gas sensors where gas is circulated through soda lime and anhydrite chemicals to remove water vapor, CO2, SO2, and H2S.
Manual setting for gas sampling.
Manual H2S sensor verification where field-deployed H2S standard gas is sampled.
Manual CO2 and SO2 sensor verifications where a field-deployed CO2 + SO2 standard gas mixture is sampled.

attr.attrdef: Average voltage of multi-GAS power source during sample cycle, uncompensated for diode drops that may be >1 volt depending on the power system design.
Average voltage during sample cycle of regulated power source used to power multi-GAS electronics.
Average temperature during sample cycle measured by a thermistor inside the instrument's datalogger.
Average ambient air temperature during sample cycle in degrees Celsius.
Average relative humidity of ambient air during sample cycle.
Average temperature recorded by a K-Type thermocouple during sample cycle. Commonly used to track volcanic gas vent or fumarole temperatures.

attrdomv.udom: NAN: Not A Number; indicates that a thermocouple was not installed or has malfunctioned.

attr.attrdef: Average pressure in the sample line of the instrument in hectopascals (hPa) during the sample cycle.
Ambient air pressure in hectopascals (hPa)
Average two-dimensional horizontal wind speed during the sample cycle

attrdomv.udom: NAN: Not A Number; indicates an error.
-999: Indicates an error.

attr.attrdef: Average two-dimensional horizontal wind direction during the sample cycle

attrdomv.udom: NAN: Not A Number; indicates an error.

attr.attrdef: Average molar mixing ratio by volume of water vapor during the sample cycle

Average molar mixing ratio by volume of carbon dioxide gas (CO2) during the sample cycle. Onboard processing with a single pole recursive lowpass filter is applied to raw CO2 data collected at 1 Hz to match the response of CO2 instrument to the electrochemical sulfur sensors. The filter takes the form: CO2_lowpass = [CO2,n*a + CO2,n-1*b] where coefficients a and b sum to equal 1 and are derived empirically from step response data from sensor calibrations.

Average molar mixing ratio by volume of sulfur dioxide gas (SO2) during the sample cycle. A pressure correction (pcorr) and linear span and offset values applied to raw sensor values: SO2=(SO2,pcorr)*SPAN+OFFSET. The appropriate pressure correction is determined by testing.

Average molar mixing ratio by volume of hydrogen sulfide gas (H2S) during the sample cycle. H2S values are not corrected for cross-sensitivity to SO2. A pressure correction (pcorr) and linear span and offset values applied to raw sensor values: H2S=(H2S,pcorr)*SPAN+OFFSET. The appropriate pressure correction is determined by testing.
Average molar ratio during the sample cycle calculated using automated onboard linear regression data processing routines and quality metrics.

attrdomv.udom: NAN: Not A Number; indicates that no ratios were calculated during the sample cycle.

attr.attrdef: Average y-intercept from linear regression to find gas ratios during the sample cycle.

attrdomv.udom: NAN: Not A Number; indicates that no ratios or intercepts were calculated during the sample cycle.

attr.attrdef: The number of valid ratios calculated in a sample cycle. Automated onboard routines calculate gas ratios every second of a sample cycle using a sliding 3-minute long window. When several quality criterea are met (r2 > 0.7, slope > 0, minimum quantities of target gases) a ratio is considered valid and is recorded. For data collected at 1 Hz, up to 1800 valid ratios may be calculated in a 30-minute long sampling period.
Average molar ratio during the sample cycle calculated using automated onboard linear regression data processing routines and quality metrics.

attrdomv.udom: NAN: Not A Number; indicates that no ratios were calculated during the sample cycle.

attr.attrdef: Average y-intercept from linear regression to find gas ratios during the sample cycle.

attrdomv.udom: NAN: Not A Number; indicates that no ratios or intercepts were calculated during the sample cycle.

attr.attrdef: The number of valid ratios calculated in a sample cycle. Automated onboard routines calculate gas ratios every second of a sample cycle using a sliding 3-minute long window. When several quality criterea are met (r2 > 0.7, slope > 0, minimum quantities of target gases) a ratio is considered valid and is recorded. For data collected at 1 Hz, up to 1800 valid ratios may be calculated in a 30-minute long sampling period.

Average molar ratio during the sample cycle calculated using automated onboard linear regression data processing routines and quality metrics. H2S values are not corrected for cross-sensitivity to SO2.

attrdomv.udom: NAN: Not A Number; indicates that no ratios were calculated during the sample cycle.

attr.attrdef: Average y-intercept from linear regression to find gas ratios during the sample cycle. H2S values are not corrected for cross-sensitivity to SO2.

attrdomv.udom: NAN: Not A Number; indicates that no ratios or intercepts were calculated during the sample cycle.

attr.attrdef: The number of valid ratios calculated in a sample cycle. Automated onboard routines calculate gas ratios every second of a sample cycle using a sliding 3-minute long window. When several quality criterea are met (r2 > 0.7, slope > 0, minimum quantities of target gases) a ratio is considered valid and is recorded. For data collected at 1 Hz, up to 1800 valid ratios may be calculated in a 30-minute long sampling period. H2S values are not corrected for cross-sensitivity to SO2.

Average molar ratio during the sample cycle calculated using automated onboard linear regression data processing routines and quality metrics. S_tot ("S total") = SO2 + H2S. H2S values are not corrected for cross-sensitivity to SO2.

attrdomv.udom: NAN: Not A Number; indicates that no ratios were calculated during the sample cycle.

attr.attrdef: Average y-intercept from linear regression to find gas ratios during the sample cycle. S_tot ("S total") = SO2 + H2S. H2S values are not corrected for cross-sensitivity to SO2.

attrdomv.udom: NAN: Not A Number; indicates that no ratios or intercepts were calculated during the sample cycle.

attr.attrdef: The number of valid ratios calculated in a sample cycle. Automated onboard routines calculate gas ratios every second of a sample cycle using a sliding 3-minute long window. When several quality criterea are met (r2 > 0.7, slope > 0, minimum quantities of target gases) a ratio is considered valid and is recorded. For data collected at 1 Hz, up to 1800 valid ratios may be calculated in a 30-minute long sampling period. S_tot ("S total") = SO2 + H2S. H2S values are not corrected for cross-sensitivity to SO2.

The average proportion of SO2 to total sulfur (SO2 + H2S), expressed as a percentage. The value is calculated from the H2S/SO2 ratio but may be inaccurate because H2S values are not corrected for cross-sensitivity to SO2.

attrdomv.udom: NAN: Not A Number; indicates that no values were calculated during the sample cycle.

attr.attrdef: The average proportion of H2S to total sulfur (SO2 + H2S), expressed as a percentage. The value is calculated from the H2S/SO2 ratio but may be inaccurate because H2S values are not corrected for cross-sensitivity to SO2.

attrdomv.udom: NAN: Not A Number; indicates that no values were calculated during the sample cycle.

enttyp.enttypd: Values from automated sensor baseline or 'zero' checks initiated prior to each sample cycle where trapped sample gas is circulated through chemical scrubbers to remove water vapor and acid gases.

edom.edomvd: Gas sensors off.
Gas sensors warming up.
Automated baseline check for gas sensors where gas is circulated through soda lime and anhydrite chemicals to remove water vapor, CO2, SO2, and H2S.
Sampling.

Manual baseline check for gas sensors where gas is circulated through soda lime and anhydrite chemicals to remove water vapor, CO2, SO2, and H2S.
Manual setting for gas sampling.

Manual CO2 and SO2 sensor verifications where a field-deployed CO2 + SO2 standard gas mixture is sampled.

attr.attrdef: Voltage of multi-GAS power source
Voltage of regulated power source used to power multi-GAS electronics
Measurement of ambient air temperature in degrees Celsius
Relative humidity of ambient air
Temperature recorded by a K-Type thermocouple. Commonly used to track volcanic gas vent or fumarole temperatures.

attrdomv.udom: NAN: Not A Number; indicates that a thermocouple was not installed or has malfunctioned.

attr.attrdef: Temperature measured by a thermistor inside the instrument's datalogger
Pressure in the sample line of the instrument in hectopascals (hPa)
Ambient air pressure in hectopascals (hPa)
Molar mixing ratio by volume of water vapor
Molar mixing ratio by volume of carbon dioxide gas (CO2)

Molar mixing ratio by volume of carbon dioxide gas (CO2) with a single pole recursive lowpass filter applied to match response of CO2 instrument to the electrochemical sulfur sensors. The filter takes the form: CO2_lowpass = [CO2,n*a + CO2,n-1*b] where coefficients a and b sum to equal 1 and are derived empirically from step response data from sensor calibrations.

Molar mixing ratio by volume of sulfur dioxide gas (SO2). A pressure correction (pcorr) and linear span and offset values applied to raw sensor values: SO2=(SO2,pcorr)*SPAN+OFFSET. The appropriate pressure correction is determined by testing.

Molar mixing ratio by volume of hydrogen sulfide gas (H2S). A pressure correction (pcorr) and linear span and offset values applied to raw sensor values: H2S=(H2S,pcorr)*SPAN+OFFSET. The appropriate pressure correction is determined by testing.
Molar mixing ratio by volume of sulfur dioxide gas (SO2) without span, offset, or pressure corrections applied.
Molar mixing ratio by volume of hydrogen sulfide gas (H2S) without span, offset, or pressure corrections applied.
Linear calibration coefficient (multiplier) applied to raw CO2 data (CO2,raw) where CO2 = (CO2,raw)*SPAN+OFFSET.
Linear offset coefficient applied to raw CO2 data (CO2,raw) where CO2 = (CO2,raw)*SPAN+OFFSET.
Linear calibration coefficient (multiplier) applied to pressure-compensated SO2 data (SO2,pcorr) where SO2 = (SO2,pcorr)*SPAN+OFFSET.
Linear offset coefficient applied to pressure-compensated SO2 data (SO2,pcorr) where SO2 = (SO2,pcorr)*SPAN+OFFSET.
Linear calibration coefficient (multiplier) applied to pressure-compensated H2S data (H2S,pcorr) where H2S = (H2S,pcorr)*SPAN+OFFSET.
Linear offset coefficient applied to pressure-compensated H2S data (H2S,pcorr) where H2S = (H2S,pcorr)*SPAN+OFFSET.

Coefficient "a" used to calculate CO2_lowpass values. The single-pole recursive lowpass filter takes the form: CO2_lowpass = [CO2,n*a + CO2,n-1*b]. The a and b coefficients sum to equal 1 and are derived empirically from step response data from sensor calibrations.

Coefficient "b" used to calculate CO2_lowpass values. The single-pole recursive lowpass filter takes the form: CO2_lowpass = [CO2,n*a + CO2,n-1*b]. The a and b coefficients sum to equal 1 and are derived empirically from step response data from sensor calibrations.

edom.edomvd: Certified standard gas values traceable to primary standards
Values derived by comparison of working standards to other standards with certified values

distinfo.distliab: Monitoring data are provided in the generic *.dat format and do not require specialized software. Standard gas data are provided in a Microsoft Excel Open XML Format Spreadsheet (*.xlsx) that can be read using many paid and free spreadsheet programs such as Microsoft Excel, Google Sheets, OpenOffice Calc, and others.

metainfo.metstdn: Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata
